item.title: North East Swimmers Shine at Ontario Junior International
item.dc:creator: Jay Manners
item.content:encoded:
North East Swimmers Shine at International Meet!

There were several of Britain’s up-and-coming swimmers that took part and gained valuable experience racing against some of the fastest juniors from around the world at the Ontario Junior International Meet. The squad were members of the British Swimming Team but were featured by their respective home nations.

There were a total of four swimmers that competed at the event from the North East, these include:

  • Ashleigh Baillie – City of Sheffield
  • Charlotte Bianchi – City of Sheffield
  • Phoebe Cooper – City of Sheffield
  • Libby Freeman – Morpeth ASC

All four girls had an impressive showing at the competition last weekend securing personal best times, season’s bests, qualifying for an international final, and even some international medals!

Ashleigh Baillie and Phoebe Cooper came away with a title to their name. Baillie secured GOLD in the 200m Butterfly, and Cooper got the 200m Individual Medley GOLD respectively.

To view the full results, please click here.

Becki McGuire (Morpeth ASC) travelled to Canada as part of the coaching team at the competition.

Congratulations swimmers and coaches on a successful weekend of racing and gaining valuable experience racing on the international stage!

*Photo Credit by Swim England*

item.title: Swim England to Launch New Club Health Tracker
item.dc:creator: David Parry
item.description: Swim England will shortly be releasing its new Club Health Tracker to help clubs ‘streamline’ their club development work. The tracker, delivered by Sporting Insights, is an online platform that […]
item.content:encoded:
Swim England will shortly be releasing its new Club Health Tracker to help clubs ‘streamline’ their club development work.

The tracker, delivered by Sporting Insights, is an online platform that will be used to support aquatic clubs with continuous improvements within six core areas of club development.

The six areas of coaching and teaching, financial management, pool operator relationships, governance and standards, growth, and volunteers will all be assessed as part of a self-assessment survey which clubs can complete in the tracker once a year.

After completing the survey, clubs will be shown an interactive results section which displays their scores compared to an average from other clubs up and down the country.

The aim is to help clubs identify their areas of strengths and weaknesses so they can target their development. The tracker also provides support to make those improvements with results catering to each individual clubs needs.

item.title: Swim England Issues Updated Guidance on Minimum Pool Depths for Racing
item.dc:creator: David Parry
item.description: Swim England have provided an update to the minimum depth of water required for swimmers to dive into a swimming pool. Following a review by Swim England and in light […]
item.content:encoded:
Swim England have provided an update to the minimum depth of water required for swimmers to dive into a swimming pool.

Following a review by Swim England and in light of a number of ‘near misses’ which involved swimmers diving into shallow water, the new guidance states the minimum depth for dive entries should be 1.35m. With specific reference to swimming, this is in line with FINA Regulations.

Full details are available to view at: https://www.swimming.org/sport/minimum-entry-depth-guidance/

item.title: Assistant Artistic Swimming Coach Education Course
item.dc:creator: David Parry
item.description: An Assistant Artistic Swimming Coach Education Course has been scheduled to take place in the Swim England North East Region. The course details are available to view at: https://www.swimming.org/ios/course/8961 Please note that the link […]
item.content:encoded:
An Assistant Artistic Swimming Coach Education Course has been scheduled to take place in the Swim England North East Region.

The course details are available to view at: https://www.swimming.org/ios/course/8961

Please note that the link is for information purposes only. The cost of the course for candidates from Swim England North East Region club’s is £220. Do not try to book a place through the link provided as this will not be possible.

If you are interested in registering for this course, please email david.parry@swimnortheast.org with the following information:

–        The candidate/s name

–        Their email address

–        Their club

–        If they would like to book their place through their personal IoS account or through their club’s IoS account? Please ensure that the relevant IoS account is set up or the place on the course cannot be allocated.

item.title: Good Club Governance Sessions
item.dc:creator: David Parry
item.description: New dates have been released for the Good Club Governance sessions which Swim England organise and deliver. These are aimed at different members of the club’s workforce to support them […]
item.content:encoded:
New dates have been released for the Good Club Governance sessions which Swim England organise and deliver. These are aimed at different members of the club’s workforce to support them in their role. Details are below:

Club Chair’s information session focusing on dealing with internal disputes on Thursday 26th January, Monday 20th February, Monday 27th March 2023.

Book your place at: https://www.surveymonkey.co.uk/r/ClubChairSessions

Club Welfare Officer information session on Wednesday 9th January, Monday 13th February, Wednesday 15th March 2023.

Book your place at: https://www.surveymonkey.co.uk/r/Welfareofficerworkshops

Club Secretary and Membership Officer information session on Monday 20th January, Thursday 9th March 2023.

Book your place at: https://www.surveymonkey.co.uk/r/Secretary-Membership

item.title: British Para Swimming Winter Championships 2022
item.dc:creator: Louise Graham
item.description: Glasgow plays host to the Winter Para Short Course Meet It was a fantastic weekend at the British Para Swimming Winter Championships held at Tollcross International pool in Glasgow, from […]
item.content:encoded:
Glasgow plays host to the Winter Para Short Course Meet

It was a fantastic weekend at the British Para Swimming Winter Championships held at Tollcross International pool in Glasgow, from 26-27th November.
Lucas Lee (S14), Doncaster Dartes, competed in the 14-17yrs age group. He managed to PB in 100m Free and 50 BR and a great 3 sec PB in the 200 free in the final session. Lucas had 4 top 10 placings at the event and when you are sharing the pool with some of the top swimmers in the GB team you have to be on top form. Well done Lucas.
Archie Hare (S11), Richmond Dales, had a 100% pb rate over the weekend with a fantastic 12 sec improvement in his 50m BC.

Nathan Brown (S10), Richmond Dales, also had great weekend with a 3 sec improvement in his 400 FC and remaining close to his other best times throughout. 

Joe Field (S5), Richmond Dales, had a fantastic weekend with a huge 45 sec pb in his 200 FC and continued improvement in all his swims. Joe is still fighting back from major surgery but is proving that nothing will hold him back. 

Maisie Catt (S7), Richmond Dales, also had a great weekend with a 100% pb rate. Her stand out swims were 400 FC with a 13 sec improvement and a 6 sec improvement in her 50 BC. 
Maisie won a Silver medal in the 13 & Under age group for 400 FC and 100 BC.
Josie Johnson (NE Disability / Darlington ASC) had a fantastic 100m free and produced an outstanding 8 sec PB followed by another improvement in her 50BR. There was no let up in performance for Josie with another improved time in the 50m Free. Finally the third session saw an awesome 8 sec PB in the 50m BC. A great performance from Josie.
Evie Lambert (S9), Borough of Kirklees, started the weekend with a great 3 sec improvement in her times for the 100m Free and 200IM and another PB in the 50m BR. Session 2 saw a great PB in the 100m BC. Session 3 saw another great improvement in the 50m BC and Evie finished off the final session with a great swim in the 100m Fly netting a fantastic 3 sec improvement on her entry time.
Astrid Carroll (S13), Borough of Kirklees, had another great meet with a 3 sec improvement in 100 Free, a 2 sec PB in the 200IM, and another PB in 50m free. Astrid’s stand out swim was an amazing 20 sec improvement in her 400m free. Astrid finished top of her age group (13 & Under) in all of her events, a fantastic achievement.
Andrew Beharie (S14), Blyth, made a 1 sec PB in the 50 Free and a 1 sec PB in the 100 Breaststroke.
Finally, we had our very own NER Para camp S & C coach, Lyndon Longhorn (S4), Derwentside ASC. Lyndon swam in 5 events, 100m Free, 150m IM, 50m Free, 50m BC, 200m Free. He broke 5 British records and swam 2 lifetime best times.
Medals were awarded based on events that the swimmer can enter specific to their classification so although we had several 1st 2nd 3rd placings, if the events were not National para events for their classification, no medals were awarded.
Report generated by Keith Hall, NE Region Para-Swimming Head Coach

item.title: North East Region Shine at Swim England National Awards!
item.dc:creator: Jay Manners
item.content:encoded:
The North East Region Won an Outstanding Number of Awards at the Swim England National Awards Ceremony 2022!

The Swim England National Awards 2022 accomplishments were celebrated at the University of Birmingham’s Great Hall, where 14 awards were presented.

The Swim England Awards kicked off with ‘Volunteer of the Year,’ which Helen Dutton won in recognition of her contribution to aquatics!

Helen Dutton, Volunteer of the Year, said she was ‘overwhelmed’ after receiving a Swim England National Award.

This year, the ‘tireless’ City of Leeds Diving Club volunteer served as the regional lead for the Swim England National Skills Final, and her ‘dilligence, selflessness, and passion’ for the sport contributed to the event’s success.

She is also the diving manager for the North East Region and was quick to praise everyone in the diving community.

Next up was the ‘Club of the Year’ Awards for the respective aquatic disciplines.

This saw City of Sheffield Diving Club and Richmond Dales ASC who were the winners of the Swim England National Awards. Special mention to Rotherham Metro Water Polo Club who were finalists in the Water Polo Club of the Year Award.

City of Sheffield Diving Club capped an ‘incredible year’ by being named Diving Club of the Year at the Swim England National Awards.

Richmond Dales won Swimming Club of the Year at the Swim England National Awards, just months after welcoming a Ukrainian family into their community.

After the family was forced to flee their homeland due to the invasion, Richmond was quick to provide the two children with the opportunity to continue swimming.

We also had Silver Award winners with Jack Naylor Dunn being in the ‘Youth Volunteer of the Year’ category and Emily Crossley in the ‘Spirit of Aquatics’ Award. An exceptional achievement for both to be recognised for these incredible awards!

Massive congratulations to the finalists as well in the following categories:

Judith Halliday – Technical Official of the Year
Marc Holdsworth – Coach of the Year

From all of us here at the North East Region we are so proud of everyone who was nominated, a finalist, and award winners. Without you all, the aquatic sports in our region would not be possible!

*Photos credited to Swim England
